page.title: 13FARMING DARTMOOR
page.content: Some farmers use {Commoners' {rights}to graze cattle and sheep on the moors. Theft is a problem. As far back as {World War Two}there was a successful conviction for stealing animals from the moor.Animals now suffer more injuries and deaths because of increasing road traffic. {Commoners}may only put animals on the moor within their parish. There are regulations governing the numbers allowed. This is not strictly enforced at the moment, so in a hard winter or in times of drought there is not enough food for the animals on the moor. There is a Bill going through Parliament at the moment which will help enforce the law. Foxes are kept under control by hunting.Badgers live on the moor and there are deer in wooded areas. Mr. Whitley's gamekeeper rears pheasants.
